newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian sugar prices dip on low consumer demand.
newsitem.headline: Indian sugar prices dip on low consumer demand.

text.p: Indian sugar prices fell on Thursday on low consumer demand and improved supplies, dealers said.
"Consumer demand was low while improved supplies dragged prices downward," a dealer said.
"Offerings by the mill owners increased on Thursday on reports that government is considering a proposal to distribute more sugar in the public distribution system for festivals," he said.
"More supplies in public distribution system will lead to lower offtake in the open market," another dealers added.
In the ready delivery sugar S-30 slid 5.0 rupees to 1,365/1,396 rupees per quintal while M-30 fell by same margin at 1,385/1,440 rupees per quintal.
But sugar mill delivery inched up 5.0 rupees to 1,315/1,325 rupees per quintal on stray support. Sentiments at the close remained subdued.
